tv.generator-info-name: WebGrab+Plus/w MDB & REX Postprocess -- version V2.0 -- Jan van Straaten

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features(n)

programme.title: The Andrew Marr Show
programme.desc: Round-up of the week's stories, featuring interviews with key figures in politics and current affairs, and leafing through the Sunday papers. Including news and weather at 9.00(n)

programme.title: The Big Questions
programme.desc: Nicky Campbell presents moral and religious discussions on topical issues from St Edward's School, Oxford(n)

programme.title: Sunday Politics
programme.desc: The week's events at Westminster, presented by Andrew Neil. Including news and a regional round-up(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Christina Trevanion presents as the hunt for bargains heads to the Brackley Antique Cellar, Northamptonshire, where two teams of best friends call upon the services of experts Charlie Ross and Catherine Southon to help them find three items in an attempt to make profit at auction. Christina also takes time out to look at some watches through the ages(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: Antiques experts Charlie Ross and Thomas Plant peruse a selection of the public's potentially valuable items on a visit to the Fleet Air Arm Museum at HMS Heron in Yeovilton, Somerset. Meanwhile, host Paul Martin travels to Forde Abbey, which was once home to Cistercian monks, and meets a family who have inherited a religious heritage that influences their everyday lives(n)

programme.title: Countryfile Spring Diaries
programme.desc: Jules Hudson investigates why native bluebells in the UK are threatened with extinction and Keeley Donovan discovers people who experience spring in a truly multi-sensory way(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: A budding writer and her husband seek a new home in the Worcestershire countryside on a budget of £375,000. Plus, Nicki Chapman meets a craftsman preserving local equine traditions(n)

programme.title: Songs of Praise
programme.desc: David Grant presents a special episode for Mothering Sunday, meeting a boxing coach helping her community and a foster mother who has taken in three asylum seekers from Afghanistan(n)

programme.title: Shop Well for Less
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Steph McGovern are in Surrey, where a year ago part-time teacher Flo took some time out to look after the couple's children, aged four, five and six - but her love of socialising means she regularly goes into her overdraft. Meanwhile, her petrolhead husband John has an expensive hobby, buying various spare parts and paying for a second garage. How will the couple feel when some of their favourite products are taken away? Plus, a group of campers test different canopies and Avi Shankar reveals how early children can be influenced by advertising(n)

programme.title: Comic Relief 2017
programme.sub-title: The Best of Red Nose Day
programme.desc: A compilation of the best moments from the 2017 fundraising event, featuring Alan Partridge, People Just Do Nothing, Toast of London and the return of Smack the Pony(n)

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: This week's show comes from Denbighshire, where Matt baker meets one of the country's most successful sheep farmers while Ellie Harrison observes the spring mating rituals of grouse and goes in search of adders on the moorland. Sean Fletcher meets an artist who makes edible flowers, Adam Henson visits a college in Cumbria that provides a sheepdog training course, and Tom Heap examines the future of British farming. Including weather for the week ahead(n)

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the show from Burton Constable Hall near Hull, which is home to a collection of treasures. Objects brought in to be valued include a ship's anchor that was found in a garden pond, a medal awarded to sailor for helping to recover Captain Scott's ship from the Antarctic in 1901, some 17th-century flat pack furniture, and a flimsy booklet that proved to be a profitable investment(n)

programme.title: Line of Duty
programme.desc: New series. Thandie Newton stars in the fourth instalment of the crime drama as a detective on the trail of a serial killer. She is determined to catch the culprit as soon as possible and prove her worth to her superiors - but a colleague fears her efforts may have led to a miscarriage of justice, and alerts the AC-12 team to the situation(n)

programme.title: Iron Man 3
programme.desc: The armoured avenger hunts for the mastermind behind an untraceable series of bombings, despite being cut off from his usual resources and traumatised by a recent brush with death. His search uncovers a secret conspiracy involving a drug that renders the user indestructible. Superhero adventure sequel, starring Robert Downey Jr, Gwyneth Paltrow and Don Cheadle(n)

programme.title: Wild Ireland: The Edge of the World
programme.desc: Part two of two. Colin Stafford-Johnson heads north from Clew Bay for Donegal - golden eagle country - before reaching the island's northern tip and turning east along the coast of Northern Ireland. Along the way he observes the whooper swans that fly in every autumn to escape the Arctic winter and the elusive pine marten, an animal resident in the area since the last Ice Age. Basking sharks, bats and salmon are among the other creatures Colin comes across as he seeks out the remotest corners of Ireland's wild west(n)

His search uncovers a secret conspiracy involving a drug that renders the user indestructible. Superhero adventure sequel, starring Robert Downey Jr, Gwyneth Paltrow and Don Cheadle(n)

programme.title: A to Z of TV Gardening
programme.desc: Carol Kirkwood looks at subjects beginning with the letter I, continuing her alphabetical journey through the world of horticulture. Along the way, she gets inspiration and advice from some of the BBC's most popular gardening presenters(n)

programme.title: An Island Parish
programme.sub-title: The Wheel Has Come Full Circle
programme.desc: It is a busy time for many as Easter approaches, with Jo Birch getting popular attraction La Seigneurie Gardens ready for the start of the tourist season. Shepherd Dave Scott is bracing himself for the onset of lambing and Bas needs to get his fishing boat painted in time, but a blizzard and a force-nine gale throw many plans into disarray(n)

programme.title: Around the World in 80 Gardens
programme.desc: Armed with a long-standing interest in Zen Buddhism, Monty Don takes his globe-trotting tour to the Orient, where he investigates two very different approaches to gardening in China and Japan. His research leads him first to China's ancient scholars' gardens in Suzhou, and after gaining a new insight into oriental horticulture, he journeys to Kyoto, the Japanese city of gardens(n)

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty starts his plans for his revamped courtyard garden, when he plants bare root trees and gives advice on climbers that will happily grow on east-facing walls. Nick Bailey explores the strange world of lichens and finds out how these plants grow and thrive on trees, wood and stone, while Frances Tophill meets the enthusiastic gardeners of Barbados who fill their gardens with colour, foliage and world class flowers. As part of the programmes 50th Anniversary, Flo Headlam reveals the plant she thinks has had the most impact on British gardens over the last half-century. Including weather(n)

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Matt Baker and Anita Rani present the show from the Hoo Peninsula, reporting on the influence of the local `salt shepherds' and efforts to protect the birds that flock to the area. Plus, there are new arrivals on Adam Henson's farm, and Tom Heap reveals what Britain leaving the EU will mean for the country's migrant labour force and the farmers who employ them(n)

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Best Bites
programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt presents highlights of the series, recalling his favourite moments from previous years in the kitchen(n)

programme.title: Nigel Slater: Eating Together
programme.desc: The food writer takes a culinary tour of Britain. Starting with old-fashioned suet dumplings, he travels to Lincolnshire to try some pea kachori and lamb samosas that have a profound personal significance. Nigel then meets a man from Poland to learn the art of Pierogi making, as well as a woman whose traditional ravioli keeps a little bit of Italy alive for her family in Bedford(n)

programme.title: Simply Nigella
programme.desc: Food writer Nigella Lawson demonstrates dishes that combine the comfort of the familiar with the excitement of the new, including fluffy oat pancakes drizzled with a raspberry and honey syrup. She offers a twist on a classic Caesar salad for a light lunch idea, and rustles up a Greek-inspired supper for friends including squid and orzo pasta, and a sweet and savoury version of a cheesecake. Nigella's simple rice bowl with ginger, radish and avocado celebrates a few choice ingredients and results in a dish that's uplifting to look at, as well as to eat(n)

programme.title: The Importance of Being Earnest
programme.desc: Two friends lead double lives, adopting an alternative identity when it suits their purposes, but both tricksters come to realise their duplicity is about to jeopardise their romantic endeavours. Comedy, based on Oscar Wilde's stage play, starring Michael Redgrave, Michael Denison, Edith Evans, Margaret Rutherford, Dorothy Tutin and Joan Greenwood(n)

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore transforms and then sells three things about to be dumped at a tip in Witley, Surrey, before giving the profits to the people who were getting rid of them(n)

programme.title: The House That £100K Built
programme.desc: Kevin and Lesley have lived on the Isle of Sheppey for over a decade and have longed for the perfect home in their dream location, and have decided to design an eye-catching house that echoes the nearby seaside. Elsewhere, farmers Sue and Tim complete the interior work in their ambitious cantilevered home, which has been an on-going project for around nine years(n)

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.sub-title: The Black Forest to Hannover - Part Two
programme.desc: Michael Portillo ventures into the Black Forest to discover the essence of Germany, and att Goettingen he discovers two sides of student life at the turn of the 20th century(n)

programme.title: Back to the Land with Kate Humble
programme.desc: The presenter follows innovative businesses in the Lake District through Spring, Summer and Autumn, painting portrait of the rugged landscape and gaining an insight the challenges they face. Kate Humble helps with lambing at a fifth generation farm who have invented the world's only wool compost, so they can keep their farming traditions alive. She also goes foraging for wild food, which went to waste until one woman realised she could turn it into unique jams and preserves that are now sold nationwide(n)

programme.title: Athletics
programme.desc: Highlights of the IAAF World Cross Country Championships, the 42nd staging of the event, which this year was held in Kampala, Uganda. Kenya won both senior titles two years ago, but were knocked off the top of the medal table for the first time in five editions by Ethiopia, who captured 11 medals in total. British hopes rested with the inaugural staging of the mixed relay, an 8km race contested by teams of two men and two women(n)

programme.title: Inside the Factory
programme.desc: Gregg Wallace explores the largest bicycle factory in Britain which produces 150 folding bike every 24 hours and joins a multi-stage manual production line to make his own bicycle. Meanwhile Cherry Healey gets some tips from Cycling Team GB to help us all improve our pedal power, including how lowering your body position can make a 10 per cent improvement to speed and efficiency. And historian Ruth Goodman reveals that folding bikes date back to the 1870s, and how 70,000 folding `parabikes' were manufactured during the Second World War, some of which played a role in the D-Day landings(n)

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: Dara O Briain and Angela Scanlon present the next stage of the contest, with robots Supernova, Frostbite, Wyrm, High 5, Crushtacean, Ironside 3, Pulsar and Apex battling it out through a series of nine face-offs. Professor Noel Sharkey, Dr Lucy Rogers and Professor Sethu Vijayakumar judge the outcomes, while Jonathan Pearce provides running commentary on the action(n)

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Chris Harris and Matt LeBlanc compete in a race across the Arabian peninsula, pitting a Bugatti Chiron against an assortment of other ways of travelling - with money no object. Rory Reid creates a life-size arcade game to put city cars to the test, and Tinie Tempah takes a ride on the Top Gear track in a Toyota GT86(n)

programme.title: Turkey with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: The first of two programmes in which the presenter explores the country that lies at the crossroads between Europe and Asia, and discovers the dramatic changes it is undergoing. The first leg of his journey begins in Istanbul, from which he travels along the Aegean coast to the hostile border with Syria. He meets refugees trying to start a new life and a billionaire taking advantage of a property boom. He moves on into the Taurus Mountains and the Black Sea Coast, and visits a community trying to keep an ancient language alive(n)

programme.title: Cold in July
programme.desc: Premiere. A small-town man is hailed as a hero after he shoots dead a burglar who had broken into his home. He begins to fear for his life when the thief's father turns up seeking revenge, which is only the first in a series of events that plunge his simple life into chaos. Crime thriller based on Joe R Lansdale's novel, starring Michael C Hall, Sam Shepard and Don Johnson(n)

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.desc: Romesh Ranganathan comperes an evening of stand-up at London's Hammersmith Apollo, treating the audience to his own brand of humour before introducing routines by comedy circuit stars Jason Byrne and Stewart Francis(n)

programme.title: A to Z of TV Gardening
programme.desc: Carol Kirkwood looks at subjects beginning with the letter I, continuing her alphabetical journey through the world of horticulture. Along the way, she gets inspiration and advice from some of the BBC's most popular gardening presenters(n)

She also goes foraging for wild food, which went to waste until one woman realised she could turn it into unique jams and preserves that are now sold nationwide(n)

programme.title: Athletics
programme.desc: Highlights of the IAAF World Cross Country Championships, the 42nd staging of the event, which this year was held in Kampala, Uganda. Kenya won both senior titles two years ago, but were knocked off the top of the medal table for the first time in five editions by Ethiopia, who captured 11 medals in total. British hopes rested with the inaugural staging of the mixed relay, an 8km race contested by teams of two men and two women(n)

programme.title: Inside the Factory
programme.desc: Gregg Wallace explores the largest bicycle factory in Britain which produces 150 folding bike every 24 hours and joins a multi-stage manual production line to make his own bicycle. Meanwhile Cherry Healey gets some tips from Cycling Team GB to help us all improve our pedal power, including how lowering your body position can make a 10 per cent improvement to speed and efficiency. And historian Ruth Goodman reveals that folding bikes date back to the 1870s, and how 70,000 folding `parabikes' were manufactured during the Second World War, some of which played a role in the D-Day landings(n)

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: Dara O Briain and Angela Scanlon present the next stage of the contest, with robots Supernova, Frostbite, Wyrm, High 5, Crushtacean, Ironside 3, Pulsar and Apex battling it out through a series of nine face-offs. Professor Noel Sharkey, Dr Lucy Rogers and Professor Sethu Vijayakumar judge the outcomes, while Jonathan Pearce provides running commentary on the action(n)

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Chris Harris and Matt LeBlanc compete in a race across the Arabian peninsula, pitting a Bugatti Chiron against an assortment of other ways of travelling - with money no object. Rory Reid creates a life-size arcade game to put city cars to the test, and Tinie Tempah takes a ride on the Top Gear track in a Toyota GT86(n)

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the show from Burton Constable Hall near Hull, which is home to a collection of treasures. Objects brought in to be valued include a ship's anchor that was found in a garden pond, a medal awarded to sailor for helping to recover Captain Scott's ship from the Antarctic in 1901, some 17th-century flat pack furniture, and a flimsy booklet that proved to be a profitable investment(n)

programme.title: Turkey with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: The first of two programmes in which the presenter explores the country that lies at the crossroads between Europe and Asia, and discovers the dramatic changes it is undergoing. The first leg of his journey begins in Istanbul, from which he travels along the Aegean coast to the hostile border with Syria. He meets refugees trying to start a new life and a billionaire taking advantage of a property boom. He moves on into the Taurus Mountains and the Black Sea Coast, and visits a community trying to keep an ancient language alive(n)

programme.title: Sunday Politics Northern Ireland
programme.desc: The week's events from around the Province with Mark Carruthers(n)

programme.title: Weather Watchers with Barra Best
programme.desc: The weather presenter and journalist examines how climate shapes everyone's lives and looks at the activities that it enables people to participate in(n)

programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt presents highlights of the series, recalling his favourite moments from previous years in the kitchen(n)

programme.desc: Two friends lead double lives, adopting an alternative identity when it suits their purposes, but both tricksters come to realise their duplicity is about to jeopardise their romantic endeavours. Plus, chef Gino De Campo invites viewers to his adopted home county of Hertfordshire to find woodland ingredients for his mushroom bruschetta(n)

programme.desc: Ray explores the Bush in the state of Victoria and tracks down two Australian icons - the kangaroo and the koala. He also canoes across a secret lake in search of the elusive duck-billed platypus, one of the only mammals that lay eggs instead of giving birth(n)

programme.title: All Star Family Fortunes (?)
programme.desc: Former Crimewatch presenter Rav Wilding and Taggart actress Blythe Duff take part in the game show, teaming up with their relatives to guess the answers to surveys of 100 people in a bid to win up to £30,000 for a charity of their choice. Vernon Kay hosts(n)

programme.title: The Voice UK (?)
programme.desc: The sought-after contract with Polydor Records becomes ever more tangible a goal as the eight remaining would-be pop icons enter the semi-final. Having survived auditions, the battle rounds, the knockout stage and the quarter-finals, the contestants should be more than a little familiar with the pressures of a live performance. However, with a place in the grand final in the offing, the pressure has never been higher for the singers. As always, coaches Will.i.am, Tom Jones, Gavin Rossdale and Jennifer Hudson are on hand to deliver their verdicts on each performer's voice-work, and ultimately cut the number of hopeful stars by half, as only four competitors can progress through to the final. Emma Willis provides viewers with access to all the backstage drama and on-stage reactions as events unfold(n)

programme.title: Dr No (?)
programme.desc: James Bond travels to the Caribbean to investigate the murder of a fellow agent, leading to a confrontation with a mysterious criminal mastermind hatching a plot to sabotage the US space programme. programme.title: Live International Football (?)
programme.sub-title: Live World Cup 2018 Qualifier: England v Lithuania
programme.desc: England v Lithuania (Kick-off 5.00pm). Mark Pougatch presents coverage of the Group F clash between the countries at Wembley Stadium. Gareth Southgate's side currently top the qualifying table, but the manager will know his men need to maintain their good form if they are to remain in top spot, with Slovenia - who play Scotland later today - breathing down their necks in second place. The Lithuanians comes into this contest having suffered a 4-0 loss away to Slovakia in their most recent qualifier, but have also claimed a 1-1 draw away to Scotland earlier in the campaign, and could make things difficult for England if they attempt to stymie their attacking play. With commentary by Clive Tyldesley and Glenn Hoddle, and analysis by Ryan Giggs, Lee Dixon and Ian Wright(n)

programme.title: You've Been Framed (?)

programme.title: Vera (?)
programme.desc: The detective is drawn into Newcastle's underworld to discover the identity of a murder victim found dead in the river, with no clue as to who he is apart from a distinctive drugs wrapper. She discovers the dead man had ties to some very dangerous people, many of whom may have wanted him dead, while a witness's testimony links the case to a remote farm where a murder took place 13 years previously. The connection brings Kenny's past back to haunt him, as he was responsible for seeing the perpetrator convicted(n)

programme.title: International Football Highlights (?)
programme.sub-title: World Cup Qualifier Highlights: England v Lithuania
programme.desc: England v Lithuania. Action from the Group F clash between the countries at Wembley Stadium, where the teams played each other for the first time in this campaign. The reverse fixture will take place in the final round of matches, and England will hope to be assured of a place in the tournament in Russia prior to that contest, so as to avoid a potential upset. Plus, highlights of Scotland v Slovenia, Northern Ireland v Norway and Republic of Ireland v Wales. Presented by Jacqui Oatley, with commentary by Clive Tyldesley, Sam Matterface, David Stowell and Joe Speight, and analysis by Paul Ince and Ally McCoist(n)

programme.desc: A cynical youngster becomes entranced by his grandfather's magical tales, which revolve around a stable-boy's heroic quest to rescue his lost love from the clutches of an evil prince, with the aid of a vengeance-seeking Spanish swashbuckler and his hulking sidekick. Rob Reiner's comic fantasy adventure, with Cary Elwes, Robin Wright, Chris Sarandon, Mandy Patinkin, Peter Falk and Fred Savage(n)

programme.title: The Wizard of Oz (?)
programme.desc: Youngster Dorothy Gale is whisked over the rainbow by a tornado into the magical land of Oz, where she inadvertently kills a wicked witch - incurring the wrath of another. Setting out to find the wizard who can show her a way home, she is joined on her journey by a scarecrow, a tin man and a cowardly lion, who all hope their own wishes will be granted. Musical fantasy, with Judy Garland, Ray Bolger, Jack Haley, Bert Lahr and Frank Morgan(n)

programme.title: The Parent Trap (?)
programme.desc: Identical twin sisters who are unaware of each other's existence meet by accident. They decide to join forces in a bid to reunite their estranged parents, and switch places to get the warring couple to kiss and make up. Remake of the 1961 Disney comedy, starring Dennis Quaid, Natasha Richardson, Elaine Hendrix and Lindsay Lohan in a dual role(n)

programme.title: Dirty Dancing (?)
programme.desc: A dance instructor at a 1960s resort hotel fears his career will be jeopardised when his regular partner is forced to pull out of an important show in which they are due to perform. Luckily, a naive teenager is happy to step in, and is treated to a whirlwind holiday education in life, love and expressing herself. Romantic drama, starring Patrick Swayze, Jennifer Grey and Jerry Orbach. Includes 5 News Update at 6pm(n)

programme.title: 5 News Weekend (?)
programme.desc: Round-up of the day's headlines from around the world(n)

programme.title: Michael Jackson's This Is It (?)
programme.desc: Documentary following rehearsals for the singer's planned 50-night series of concerts at London's O2, immediately before his untimely death in 2009. Featuring interviews with Jackson, performances of classic hits including Billy Jean and Wanna Be Startin' Something, and an insight into the elaborate preparations for the shows that were never staged(n)

programme.title: Michael Jackson: Man in the Mirror (?)
programme.desc: Profile of the singer, following his development from child star with the Jackson 5 to becoming an iconic performer in his own right as an adult. The programme explores his difficult relationship with his family and makes the case that growing up in the public eye had a devastating psychological impact that he was never able to recover from(n)

programme.title: Rich and Acquitted (?)
programme.desc: The singer's 2005 trial on charges of child molestation, which concluded with him being found not guilty on all charges. Featuring in-depth interviews from Jackson's attorneys and the prosecution, who discuss the circumstances of the case and the factors that led to the prosecution case collapsing(n)

programme.desc: A chance to purchase goods from the comfort of home(n)

programme.desc: A man from Los Angeles is given $25,000 to plan every detail of his nuptials in just three weeks, but while he wants a futuristic ceremony, his bride is hoping for a traditional fairy-tale wedding(n)

programme.desc: Documentary following police in Birmingham as they tackle the rising problem of crime on the country's motorways. Two officers are involved in a high-speed chase that takes them into the city centre and PC Richard Elliot is called to a lorry park off the M6, where a gang has been disturbed while attempting to steal a driver's load. Plus, more than 20 motorway cops, a dog team and a helicopter are called to stop a gang of thieves(n)

programme.title: Choccywoccydoodah (?)

programme.title: Celebrity MasterChef (?)
programme.desc: The pressure is on for John Thomson, Adrian Edmondson, Denise Black and Phillips Idowu as the first elimination day in the 2013 contest arrives. To begin with, the celebrity cooks are paired off and given a taste of working in London restaurants, where their eyes are opened to the reality of full live service. Back in the relative calm of the MasterChef kitchen, the stars remain in their pairs to create a main course and a dessert in a test of culinary excellence and teamwork. There's then one last chance to prove themselves to John Torode and Gregg Wallace, before the judges decide who is out(n)

programme.title: Celebrity MasterChef (?)
programme.desc: The second quarter-final of the 2013 contest sees the return of reigning champion Emma Kennedy, 2011 winner Phil Vickery and 2010 finalist Christine Hamilton, who are helping to judge the contestants' efforts in their final challenge - to simply prepare a two-course meal. Gregg Wallace and John Torode have already said goodbye to one of the four hopefuls - John Thomson - but which one of the remaining three will be taking off their chef's apron tonight? Phillips Idowu, Denise Black and Adrian Edmondson battle it out(n)

programme.title: Celebrity MasterChef (?)
programme.desc: Boyzone star Shane Lynch, former Coronation Street bad guy Brian Capron, comedian Shappi Khorsandi and TV presenter Miranda Krestovnikoff compete in the third heat of the 2013 culinary competition, aiming to make it to the end of the week in the top two. Their first challenge is the mystery box, where they are given ingredients including a whole saddle of goat. Then they try to recreate John Torode's deceptively simple tomato tart with herb salad - as usual, without a recipe - and finally enter the world of catering, feeding more than 100 students at Goldsmiths College, London(n)

programme.title: Doctor Who (?)
programme.desc: Part one of two. When an ambitious project to drill into the Earth wakens an ancient enemy, the Doctor leaps into action. As Amy learns she cannot trust even the ground under her feet, it becomes clear that while humans were digging down, another species was on its way up. Meera Syal, Neve McIntosh and Robert Pugh guest star alongside Matt Smith and Karen Gillan(n)

programme.title: Doctor Who (?)
programme.desc: Part two of two. The Doctor tries to persuade mankind and the reptilian Silurians to live in peace and share the Earth. However, the leader of the reptiles' military is determined to wage war, while some of the humans plot a desperate reprisal of their own. Meera Syal, Neve McIntosh and Robert Pugh guest star alongside Matt Smith, Karen Gillan and Arthur Darvill(n)

programme.title: Oliver (?)
programme.desc: Oscar-winning musical version of the stage play based on Charles Dickens' classic tale about a lonely workhouse orphan who ends up on the cold streets of London, where he falls under the wing of petty crook Fagin and his gang of young backstreet thieves. Featuring the iconic songs Food, Glorious Food, Consider Yourself, As Long as He Needs Me and You've Got to Pick a Pocket or Two. Starring Ron Moody, Mark Lester, Oliver Reed, Jack Wild, Harry Secombe, Shani Wallis and Leonard Rossiter(n)

programme.desc: Sue and Pete try to survive being trapped in a foreign airport with their children, and as the delays continue and the security checks multiply, a game of I Spy takes an unexpected turn. Partly improvised comedy, starring Hugh Dennis, Claire Skinner and David Ryall(n)

programme.title: Outnumbered (?)
programme.desc: Sue and Pete go out for a meal together and leave the children with a Croatian babysitter, who has a night she will never forget. A big decision about Grandad's future also looms. Partly improvised comedy, starring Hugh Dennis, Claire Skinner and David Ryall(n)

programme.title: Outnumbered (?)
programme.desc: Karen becomes preoccupied with Satan, while Ben falls foul of a hardline football referee. Meanwhile, Sue tries to compete with the impossibly perfect mother next door and Grandad is alarmed by TV shows that look down people's toilets. Guy Jenkin and Andy Hamilton's part-improvised domestic comedy, starring Hugh Dennis, Claire Skinner and David Ryall(n)

programme.title: One Born Every Minute (?)
programme.desc: The documentary returns from a new location, capturing daily life in Liverpool Women's Hospital, home to the largest maternity unit in Europe. Gary, 48, tries to keep his 41-year-old partner Yvonne smiling through her contractions, while 25-year-old Jennifer and 26-year-old Darran support each other through a difficult labour. The couple were told at their 20-week scan that their baby daughter had a heart defect, but it will not be until the birth that they know how badly it might affect her(n)

programme.title: Dr Christian Will See You Now (?)
programme.desc: Medic Christian Jessen and his team of in-house specialists treat Ruby, who has alopecia and is suffering from low self-esteem(n)

programme.sub-title: John Bishop: In Conversation with Olly Murs
programme.desc: The singer talks about his rise to fame since The X Factor, life in the public eye and the strain that being a pop star has placed on his family life(n)

programme.title: Murdered by My Boyfriend (?)
programme.desc: Drama about a teenage girl's romance with an older man who, although handsome and initially charming, soon begins to dominate every aspect of her life as his jealous and possessive nature gets out of control. Starring Georgina Campbell and Royce Pierreson(n)

programme.title: Louis Theroux: Transgender Kids (?)
programme.desc: Louis travels to San Francisco, where pioneering medical professionals are helping children who say they were born in the wrong body to transition from one sex to the other. At the Child and Adolescent Gender Centre at UCSF Hospital, he meets youngsters who have been diagnosed with gender dysphoria and who are undergoing medical interventions, from puberty blockers to hormone-replacement therapy and ultimately gender-reassignment surgery. Louis spends time with the clinic's patients and their families as they negotiate their way along this life-changing and emotional journey(n)

programme.desc: Cliff's loyalties are divided when his postie girlfriend commits a mail offence on his behalf. Comedy, starring John Ratzenberger(n)

programme.title: I Can Cook (?)

programme.title: Emmerdale (?)

programme.title: Coronation Street (?)
programme.desc: Long-running drama with the residents of England's most famous cobbled street(n)

programme.title: The Voice UK (?)
programme.desc: The sought-after contract with Polydor Records becomes ever more tangible a goal as the eight remaining would-be pop icons enter the semi-final. Having survived auditions, the battle rounds, the knockout stage and the quarter-finals, the contestants should be more than a little familiar with the pressures of a live performance. However, with a place in the grand final in the offing, the pressure has never been higher for the singers. As always, coaches Will.i.am, Tom Jones, Gavin Rossdale and Jennifer Hudson are on hand to deliver their verdicts on each performer's voice-work, and ultimately cut the number of hopeful stars by half, as only four competitors can progress through to the final. Emma Willis provides viewers with access to all the backstage drama and on-stage reactions as events unfold(n)

programme.title: You've Been Framed (?)
programme.desc: Harry Hill narrates another selection of comical mishaps filmed by viewers, including an unusual take on Ninja Warrior UK, a preview of what Ant and Dec might look like in their sixties, and a fine example of why riding a bicycle is not the best time to take a selfie. Plus, a family is soaked by what appears to be an exploding colon(n)

programme.title: The Hot Desk (?)
programme.desc: Rock band the Vamps receive a grilling in an interview over the Hot Desk from Dave Berry, Emma Willis, Nicole Appleton and Melanie Blatt(n)

programme.title: Ant & Dec's Saturday Night Takeaway (?)
programme.desc: The entertainer duo's weekend show continues as they welcome back the Takeaway Photobooth, returning for the first time this series. Suspicions continue to rise as Emilia Fox gets ever closer to unveiling the identity of MaskFace, and Ant v Dec takes a medieval bent as the pair try their hands at archery. Plus, another lucky member of the audience is given a chance to Win the Ads, and Take That join the presenters for a special End of the Show Show(n)

programme.title: Cats & Dogs: The Revenge of Kitty Galore (?)
programme.desc: A secret war between cats and dogs is fought under the unsuspecting noses of the human race. When a rogue feline hatches a plan to bring down both sides and their owners, her fellow cats are forced to seek an alliance with their canine enemies to foil her scheme. Comedy sequel, starring Chris O'Donnell, and featuring the voices of James Marsden, Nick Nolte and Bette Midler(n)

programme.desc: Conclusion of the storyteller's rags-to-riches tale, giving an insight into the people who inspired his fantasy world. Drama, starring Kieran Bew, James Fox, Simon Callow, Emily Hamilton, Geraldine James and Alison Steadman(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat (?)
programme.desc: Gina is suspected of being a hit-and-run driver, while Vernon is hired to escort two singers to a gig - but soon discovers he has an aversion to loud music and offloads the responsibility onto David, who is no match for the conniving pair(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat (?)
programme.desc: Tricia is over the moon as she and Mike finally declare their love for one another - but gets drawn into a case of domestic violence before she has chance to celebrate, and ends up fighting for her life. Starring Clare Calbraith and Jason Durr(n)

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote (?)
programme.desc: When one of her friends is charged with murdering her abusive husband, Jessica sets about proving her innocence and comes up with a list of suspects including the victim's mistress and stepson. Angela Lansbury stars(n)

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote (?)
programme.desc: While promoting her new mystery novel in Las Vegas, Jessica investigates the murder of a casino manager and sets out to prove a friend's partner is not guilty of the crime. Guest starring Howard Keel (Dallas) and David Soul (Starsky and Hutch), with Angela Lansbury as the amateur sleuth(n)

programme.title: The Return of Sherlock Holmes (?)
programme.sub-title: Sherlock Holmes: The Hound of the Baskervilles
programme.desc: Sherlock Holmes and Dr Watson protect the last remaining member of the aristocratic Baskervilles, who believes his family is being haunted by a monstrous spectral hound roaming the remote Devon moors. Feature-length mystery based on Conan Doyle's classic story, starring Jeremy Brett, Edward Hardwicke, Ronald Pickup and Kristoffer Tabori(n)

programme.title: Anne of Green Gables (?)
programme.desc: A retelling of LM Montgomery's story of Anne Shirley, an orphan who is accidentally sent to a couple looking to adopt a boy instead. Family drama, starring Ella Ballentine, Sara Botsford and Martin Sheen(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Marple (?)
programme.desc: The sleuth is called to Gossington Hall by her old friend Dolly Bantry (Joanna Lumley) when she finds the corpse of an unknown blonde in the library of her home. It soon transpires that there is no shortage of suspects, including local bad boy Basil Blake (Ben Miller) and Dolly's husband Arthur (James Fox), but when the victim is identified as a dancer in line to inherit a fortune, enquiries take a different turn. Crime drama, starring Geraldine McEwan, with Simon Callow, Jack Davenport and Tara Fitzgerald(n)

programme.title: Midsomer Murders (?)
programme.desc: Barnaby and Scott investigate when a man collapses and dies outside a pub after a fight with his brother-in-law. The discovery of suspicious burn marks on the victim's forehead reveals sinister secrets and when a second body is found, the detectives are drawn into a world of superstition and family tensions. Murder mystery with John Nettles, John Hopkins and guest starring Geoffrey Whitehead(n)

programme.title: Paul O'Grady: For the Love of Dogs (?)
programme.desc: The comedian continues to help staff at Battersea Dogs & Cats Home care for stray and abandoned animals, but faces a delicate challenge when a behaviourist enlists him to work with a Rottweiler-bull mastiff cross that has developed a fear of men. Workers in the clinic try to find a home for two dogs that have developed a close friendship, and the centre receives a visit from its first celebrity ambassador - model David Gandy(n)

programme.title: Paul O'Grady: For the Love of Dogs (?)
programme.desc: The Battersea staff take the dogs across the Thames to visit the Chelsea Pensioners and Paul is asked to look after one of the home's most popular animals - a stubborn old Staffie that prefers spending time in the offices rather than its kennel. He also meets a severely disabled puppy as vets battle to save its life, and helps an overweight pooch lose a few pounds(n)

programme.title: It'll Be Alright on the Night (?)
programme.desc: Griff Rhys Jones returns to showcase another selection of hilarious film and TV outtakes rescued from the cutting-room. Among the stars whose gaffes are highlighted in this edition are Elton John, David Beckham and Ricky Gervais, and fumbled takes from the sets of Coronation Street, Mr Selfridge and EastEnders also make an appearance. Plus, mistakes from The One Show demonstrate the perils of live TV, and Jeremy Kyle has a painful encounter with a stray camera(n)

programme.title: Rising Damp Forever (?)
programme.desc: Part two of two. The crew of the sitcom and star Don Warrington are reunited, while director Joe McGrath and actor Christopher Strauli discuss making the movie version(n)

programme.title: Rising Damp (?)
programme.desc: Seedy landlord Rigsby takes in a seemingly respectable new lodger who jeopardises his efforts to romance tenant Miss Jones - but the new arrival may not be all he appears. Meanwhile, the addition of a rugby playing art student to the house sparks a fitness craze that leads Rigsby to enter a boxing match. Comedy based on the 1970s sitcom, starring Leonard Rossiter, Frances de la Tour and Don Warrington(n)

Plus, mistakes from The One Show demonstrate the perils of live TV, and Jeremy Kyle has a painful encounter with a stray camera(n)

programme.desc: Richard and Hazel open their doors to Belgian refugees while they await news of James, but a language barrier develops and the servants are unimpressed by the guests' ideas of cleanliness(n)

programme.title: Upstairs, Downstairs (?)
programme.desc: James ruins his chances of gaining a medal by telling dinner party guests about the Army running out of ammunition at the front. Meanwhile, Edward returns from fighting and finds a very receptive Daisy waiting for him(n)

programme.title: Upstairs, Downstairs (?)
programme.desc: Hazel faces the task of informing Georgina that the man she loved has been killed in the war. Meanwhile, staff at Eaton Place begin to suspect anyone with German ancestry(n)

programme.title: The Glass (?)
programme.desc: Drama, starring John Thaw as Jim Proctor, founder of a successful double glazing company, and Sarah Lancashire as Carol Parker, his employee and long-term girlfriend. In the first instalment, big changes are afoot as Jim decides to hand over the running of the business to his dashing young nephew, and Carol gets the wrong end of the stick when she overhears them discussing the future of the business. With Joseph McFadden and Paul Jesson(n)

programme.title: Peak Practice (?)
programme.desc: A girl arrives in Cardale hoping to make a fresh start, while Andrew finally decides to tell Erica how he feels(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat (?)
programme.desc: Kate meets a couple trying to raise the money to send their eight-year-old son to a Swiss sanatorium to cure his TB, Greengrass is persuaded to play Santa, and a spate of Christmas tree thefts hits Aidensfield. Sixties police drama, starring Nick Berry and Niamh Cusack(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat (?)
programme.desc: Mayhem and disorder erupts in the village when stolen loot from a robbery resurfaces(n)

programme.title: My Uncle Silas (?)
programme.desc: The lovable rogue woos stuck-up Lady Featherstone while doing a spot of grave-digging, then takes his nephew poaching - to disastrous effect. Edward finally meets Mrs Gadsby and cannot help but admire her plump pair of doves. Double bill of the drama series based on the tales by HE Bates, starring Albert Finney as Uncle Silas. With Charlotte Rampling and Lynda Bellingham(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot (?)
programme.desc: The sleuth falls asleep during a flight from Paris to London, while a female passenger is murdered by a poisoned dart, leaving few clues to the killer's identity. Poirot soon discovers she was a money-lender, which may provide a motive for the killing. The investigation is turned on its head, however, when the victim's illegitimate daughter comes forward to claim the inheritance. Whodunit, starring David Suchet, with David Firth, Jenny Downham and John Bleasdale(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot (?)
programme.desc: When the sleuth's dentist is found dead just minutes after he leaves his surgery, Chief Inspector Japp believes it to be suicide - but Poirot has reason to think otherwise and embarks on his own investigation. Drama, starring David Suchet(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot (?)
programme.desc: The dapper detective accepts an invitation to spend yuletide at the house of an elderly millionaire who seems intent on provoking his money-grubbing sons into murdering him. At first he tries hard to ignore the strained atmosphere and relax - but soon finds himself with a gruesome mystery on his hands. Agatha Christie whodunit, starring David Suchet and Philip Jackson(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot (?)
programme.desc: An American businessman fears his life is in danger while travelling on the Orient Express from Istanbul to Paris, and offers fellow passenger Poirot $10,000 for protection. After rejecting the proposal, the sleuth wakes up the following morning to learn the man has been stabbed to death while the train was held up by heavy snow in Serbia. Racing against time to find the killer among the passengers, Poirot must look to the past to solve the crime, and is faced with a decision that will haunt him for ever. David Suchet takes the title role in the murder mystery, with guest stars Hugh Bonneville, David Morrissey and Eileen Atkins(n)

programme.title: Unforgotten (?)
programme.desc: Nicola Walker and Sanjeev Bhaskar return as detectives Cassie and Sunny, who find themselves thrown into another historic murder case with the discover of a body. This time it's the perfectly preserved remains of a middle-aged man found in a suitcase in the silt of a London river. As the detectives begin the complicated task of trying to identify the victim, four unconnected people go about their business - Brighton-based lawyer Colin Osborne, paediatric nurse Marion Kelsey, teacher Sara Mahmoud and respected police officer Tessa Nixon - unaware they are about to be dragged into the investigation. Nicola Walker and Sanjeev Bhaskar star, with Mark Bonnar, Lorraine Ashbourne, Charlie Condou and Wendy Craig(n)

programme.title: The Bachelor USA (?)
programme.desc: Chris spends the day at the beach with eight of the ladies, while his three sisters interview the other seven bachelorettes back at the mansion(n)

programme.title: Million Dollar Listing: NYC (?)
programme.desc: Fredrik tries to make a sale to Chinese customers, Ryan receives a very special delivery, and old friends make an appearance with a new property in Harlem(n)

programme.title: The Real Housewives of Orange County (?)
programme.desc: The housewives attend the final party of the summer, during which Simon and Tamra argue, Lynne's daughters arrive drunk, and Gretchen and Slade spark suspicion(n)

programme.title: The Real Housewives of Orange County (?)
programme.desc: The first of two programmes in which the women reunite to look back over the events of the fifth series(n)

programme.title: The Real Housewives of Orange County (?)
programme.desc: The women continue their look back over the events of the fifth season(n)

programme.title: The Real Housewives of Orange County (?)
programme.desc: Tamra invites all the women on a shopping trip, but it is not long before Gretchen's temper flares(n)

programme.title: The Real Housewives of Orange County (?)
programme.desc: Gretchen is unsure about whether she is ready to get married again, while Alexis, Peggy and their daughters go to the park(n)

programme.desc: Spin-off from The Real Housewives of Atlanta following preparations for Kim Zolciak and Kroy Bierman's wedding(n)

programme.desc: The whole gang escape Essex for the bright lights of London, while the animosity between Chloe M and Amber T boils over into their most explosive argument yet(n)

programme.title: The Only Way Is Essex (?)
programme.desc: Chloe L makes a shocking admission about Dan, and Gemma's egg-freezing mission steps up a gear. Courtney sets some ground rules with Myles(n)

programme.title: The Bachelor USA (?)
programme.desc: The bachelorettes go white water rafting in New Mexico, while a leading contender enjoys a hot air balloon ride. A woman from Chris' past turns up at a party(n)

programme.title: The Real Housewives of Atlanta (?)
programme.desc: Kim has a new circle of friends, but finds they do not approve of her idea of beauty. Kandi and Todd brush up their parenting skills, and Cynthia is let down by one of her friends(n)

programme.title: The Only Way Is Essex (?)
programme.desc: Pete and Megan celebrate their anniversary, Georgia challenges Amber T and Yazmin over their comments about her, and Dan wonders if Chloe L still has feelings for him(n)

programme.title: The Millionaire Matchmaker (?)
programme.sub-title: Mr President Meets the Beverly Hillbilly
programme.desc: Patti Stanger plans a Valentine's Ball for her two young entrepreneur millionaires - a Barack Obama lookalike and a Tennessee man who is searching for a modern city girl who is able to respect his country values(n)

programme.title: Southern Charm (?)
programme.desc: Thomas adjusts to life in the aftermath of the election, but Kathryn cannot let go of the past. Patricia organises a charity event, and Shep and Craig taking part in a date auction(n)

programme.title: Movie Talk Shorts (?)
programme.desc: Actor Alfred Molina discusses his recent and upcoming movie projects(n)

programme.title: Is Your Honeymoon Really Necessary (?)
programme.desc: American army pilot Laurie Vining is on leave in London for his honeymoon. His happiness is shattered when his first wife arrives at his hotel, insisting that they are still married. Comedy, starring Bonar Colleano, Diana Dors, Sidney James and David Tomlinson(n)

programme.title: Diana: The People's Princess (?)
programme.desc: The life of Diana, Princess of Wales, which was cut short so regrettably in a car crash in 1997. Friends and former colleagues offer an insight into her true personality(n)

programme.title: Shakespeare: The King's Man (?)
programme.desc: Series exploring the playwright's life during the reign of James I, beginning with a look at how he wrote about regime change and political tensions(n)

programme.title: This Week in London (?)
programme.desc: Historic footage of events that made the headlines during the city's past(n)

programme.title: London Live News (?)
programme.desc: News headlines, travel, weather and debate from across the capital(n)

programme.title: BFI London (?)
programme.desc: Documentary from 1955, following two children on a trip around London(n)

programme.title: Things to Come (?)
programme.desc: Science fiction tale, based on HG Wells' novel charting a possible future history for the human race. A decades-long world war plunges Earth into a new dark age, but a group of scientists set out to reclaim civilisation from anarchy. Over the next century, incredible technological advances are made - but many believe that humanity has been sacrificed in the name of science. Ambitious and visually impressive, if preachy and theatrical drama, starring Raymond Massey, Edward Chapman and Ralph Richardson(n)

programme.title: That Hamilton Woman (?)
programme.desc: Lord Horatio Nelson's has a scandalous romance with Lady Emma Hamilton, an affair which took place against the backdrop of the Napoleonic wars. Historical drama, starring Vivien Leigh and Laurence Olivier(n)

programme.title: London Live News (?)
programme.desc: News headlines, travel, weather and debate from across the capital(n)

programme.title: Confessions from the Underground (?)
programme.desc: Documentary taking a behind-the-scenes look at the London Underground, the world's oldest subway system, revealing the dilemmas and pressures faced by its 19,000 employees. Staff explain how they negotiate the difficulties of storing dead bodies after suicides and the hazards posed by an ageing infrastructure while fixing signal failures. In addition to making sure the lines run smoothly, the workers are regularly confronted with numerous targets, aggressive passengers and emergency situations(n)

programme.title: A Private Function (?)
programme.desc: In post-war Yorkshire, with rationing still very much in force, a mild-mannered chiropodist tries to prove his worth to the snobbish locals by kidnapping a pig which is being fattened up for a local banquet. Alan Bennett's comedy, starring Michael Palin, Maggie Smith, Denholm Elliott, Alison Steadman and Liz Smith(n)

programme.title: Essex Boys: Retribution (?)
programme.desc: The aftermath of the notorious murder of three successful drug dealers proves to have far-reaching consequences. Years later, ambitious young criminals look to make their own mark on the underworld, while others seek revenge for the killing, setting in motion a brutal cycle of gangland violence. Crime drama sequel, starring Alex Esmail and Ian Virgo(n)

programme.title: The Man Inside (?)
programme.desc: A criminal's son lives in constant fear that he will turn out like his abusive imprisoned father. A boxing gym offers him a sanctuary from his past and the chance to safely release his aggression, but he faces a constant struggle to keep his violent impulses in check. Drama, starring Ashley Bashy Thomas, David Harewood, Michelle Ryan and Peter Mullan(n)

programme.title: Home Shopping (?)
programme.desc: A chance to purchase goods from the comfort of home(n)

programme.title: Life Story (?)
programme.desc: Naturalist David Attenborough documents the universal tale that unites humanity with every other animal on the planet - the journey through life, and the goal to continue the bloodline through offspring. This edition focuses on the first hurdle any animal will face, surviving infancy. Cameras follow flightless barnacle goose chicks as they strive to find food, leaping 400ft down a cliff from the ledge where they hatched. Meanwhile, in New Zealand, young fur seals have stumbled across a safe haven in which they can learn how to avoid predators, while deep in the Gobi Desert, the long-eared jerboa learns to use its impeccable hearing to catch insect pray. Plus, albatross chicks make their first flight, as threatening tiger sharks wait patiently for them to slip up and land in the sea(n)

programme.title: Life Story (?)
programme.desc: David Attenborough details the transition animals go through as they grow into adults. Looking at examples including a tiger cub whose family is under threat, a vulnerable veined octopus and a pair of sibling cheetahs guarding against starvation, the veteran naturalist illustrates how they develop new skills and learn how to survive on their own(n)

programme.title: Life Story (?)
programme.desc: The importance of homes to animals, not only as a place to live but as a shelter from the elements and a refuge from enemies. A pack of African hunting dogs have made their home on a vast plain in Zambia, but it's far from safe as they must battle hyenas and protect their young. Hermit crabs on a tropical island settle down in empty snail shells - and when a new property washes ashore, they all form a queue, then move up the housing chain until all the shells are taken. On the edge of the Sahara are chimpanzees, whose survival relies on knowing where to find water in the most extreme droughts. Here the elders lead a troop on a brutal trek to a dried-out riverbed to dig wells(n)

programme.title: Life Story (?)
programme.desc: The importance of power in the animal kingdom, revealing how dominant creatures have the best access to food and water, and are also the most attractive to the opposite sex. An orphaned young chimp tries to climb the social ladder, but his troop is ruled by big, aggressive males and his first attempt to join them ends in a beating. A meerkat society will only allow newcomers in if they know how to deal with a venomous snake. And the only way to occupy the top spot in a meadow of kangaroos is to beat the ruling male in a boxing match - but few have challenged the current incumbent, who stands at 8ft. Will any animal dare take him on? David Attenborough narrates(n)

programme.title: Life Story (?)
programme.desc: David Attenborough reveals how the competition to breed creates scenes of the most extraordinary beauty, as well as some of the most violent battles seen in nature. A male flame bowerbird shows off its artistic prowess to impress a potential mate - but if that does not prove enough, it will demonstrate its dancing skills instead. Waved albatrosses pair up for life and spend hours in each other's company, although things are not so simple for a male peacock jumping spider - one wrong move in its dazzling courtship routine could prove fatal. However, one of the most magnificent displays of all is created by a tiny male pufferfish, which impresses the ladies by building a spectacular underwater `crop circle' in the sand - arguably the most perfect and complex structure created by any animal(n)

programme.title: Life Story (?)
programme.desc: David Attenborough's documentary charting the circle of life in the animal kingdom ends with creatures' attempts to rear their offspring, revealing the commitment involved and how for some parents it means risking their own lives. A turtle hauls itself up the beach to lay its eggs in a safe place, only for the tide to trap it behind a wall of coral. A mother bonobo in the Congo teaches its son the skills it will need to survive adulthood, bison protect their calves from the ever-present threat of wolves and a mother zebra has to lead its foal across a dangerous river(n)

programme.title: Life Story (?)
programme.desc: Naturalist David Attenborough documents the universal tale that unites humanity with every other animal on the planet - the journey through life, and the goal to continue the bloodline through offspring. This edition focuses on the first hurdle any animal will face, surviving infancy. Cameras follow flightless barnacle goose chicks as they strive to find food, leaping 400ft down a cliff from the ledge where they hatched. Meanwhile, in New Zealand, young fur seals have stumbled across a safe haven in which they can learn how to avoid predators, while deep in the Gobi Desert, the long-eared jerboa learns to use its impeccable hearing to catch insect pray. Plus, albatross chicks make their first flight, as threatening tiger sharks wait patiently for them to slip up and land in the sea(n)

programme.title: Life Story (?)
programme.desc: David Attenborough details the transition animals go through as they grow into adults. Looking at examples including a tiger cub whose family is under threat, a vulnerable veined octopus and a pair of sibling cheetahs guarding against starvation, the veteran naturalist illustrates how they develop new skills and learn how to survive on their own(n)

programme.title: Life Story (?)
programme.desc: The importance of homes to animals, not only as a place to live but as a shelter from the elements and a refuge from enemies. A pack of African hunting dogs have made their home on a vast plain in Zambia, but it's far from safe as they must battle hyenas and protect their young. Hermit crabs on a tropical island settle down in empty snail shells - and when a new property washes ashore, they all form a queue, then move up the housing chain until all the shells are taken. On the edge of the Sahara are chimpanzees, whose survival relies on knowing where to find water in the most extreme droughts. Here the elders lead a troop on a brutal trek to a dried-out riverbed to dig wells(n)

programme.title: Nelson's Caribbean Hell-Hole: An Eighteenth Century Navy Graveyard Uncovered (?)
programme.desc: After the discovery of human bones on a beach in Antigua, historian Sam Willis investigates one of the darkest chapters of Britain's imperial past. As archaeologists excavate a mass grave of British soldiers, he explores the island's ruins and discovers how the sugar islands of the Caribbean were rife with sun, sea, war, tropical diseases and poisoned rum(n)

programme.title: Timewatch (?)
programme.desc: The story of secret agent Noor Inayat Khan, who was employed by the British in 1943. Hoping to infiltrate Nazi-occupied Paris, the Prime Minister sent her on a mission he never expected her to survive. Despite being captured, she refused to betray the Allies, even under torture(n)

programme.title: Secrets of Britain (?)
programme.sub-title: Secrets of Her Majesty's Secret Service
programme.desc: The documentary series exploring the less well known side of Britain continues, with this edition exploring MI6, asking whether the shadowy world of espionage and counter-intelligence operations bear any resemblance to the James Bond novels(n)

programme.title: South Pacific (?)
programme.desc: The struggle for survival on the region's isolated islands, home to flightless parrots, burrowing bats, giant skinks and tree-dwelling kangaroos. The documentary reveals how the arrival of new species can upset the delicate natural balance, with disastrous consequences, and explores the human history of the region. Benedict Cumberbatch narrates(n)

programme.title: South Pacific (?)
programme.desc: Efforts to preserve the marine life of the region, which is home to the world's richest coral reefs and an array of species, including whales, sharks, albatross and tuna. Despite millions of people relying on its fish stocks, the seas have very little protection and face various threats, with international fishing fleets taking a disastrous toll. Benedict Cumberbatch narrates(n)

programme.title: Ocean Giants (?)
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the lives of the planet's largest marine mammals and the secrets of their survival. Cameramen Doug Allan and Didier Noirot travel from the Indian Ocean to the Arctic seas, filming 200-ton blue whales and fighting humpbacks. The team also discovers that southern right whales possess a pair of one-ton testicles and reveals how Arctic bowheads can live to be more than 200 years old. Narrated by Stephen Fry(n)

programme.title: Ocean Giants (?)
programme.desc: The documentary explores the intelligence of marine mammals, discovering just how smart whales and dolphins really are. Scientist Denise Herzing talks about the development of a two-way communication system between dolphins and humans in the Bahamas, while in Western Australia the creatures are filmed using a range of survival skills. In Mexico, grey whales seemingly empathise with humans, while the humpbacks of Alaska pool their talents to increase hunting success. Narrated by Stephen Fry(n)

programme.title: Ocean Giants (?)
programme.desc: Stephen Fry narrates this documentary exploring the vocal ranges of marine mammals. Sperm whales produce clicks to locate giant squid two miles beneath the ocean surface, and narwhals use a similar technique to find breathing holes in Arctic ice floes. Bottlenose dolphins communicate with fishermen in Brazil, humpbacks offer haunting operatic performances and boto dolphins create bat-like ultrasonic calls to help find fish in the murky Amazon River(n)

programme.title: Super Giant Animals (?)
programme.desc: Steve Backshall travels across the world to encounter the largest animals he can find and discover the remarkable things their size enables them to do. Highlights include Steve swimming with Nile crocodiles in Botswana, dodging two-ton elephant seals in California and diving with sperm whales in the Caribbean(n)

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are (?)
programme.desc: BBC news correspondent Frank Gardner sets out to find out whether there is any truth in his late mother's claim that her side of the family arrived in Britain with the Normans. Along the way, he traces his ancestry back to his 10-time great-grandfather Sir Michael Stanhope - a knight of the Tudor court, who was accused of treason. But the journey does not end there, as he gets much closer to his mother's suspicions than he could ever have imagined(n)

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are (?)
programme.desc: Anita Rani makes her second BBC One appearance of the week, although unlike her Strictly Come Dancing performance, this delve into her family's past proves to be a much more sobering affair. Anita never met her maternal grandfather Sant Singh, but she knows he had another wife and family before meeting her grandmother - and that he suffered terrible tragedy at the time of India's Partition. Here the broadcaster travels to India to see if she can find out more about his first family and what happened to them. It proves to be an extraordinary and harrowing journey for the broadcaster(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory (?)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory (?)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory (?)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory (?)
programme.desc: There is a clash of personalities when Sheldon and Leonard's mothers finally meet, while Howard finally decides to do his fair share of the housework - but not without a little help from his friends. Guest starring Christine Baranski and Laurie Metcalf(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory (?)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory (?)
programme.desc: Sheldon discovers a surprise screening of The Avengers is scheduled at a local cinema, complete with a Q&A session with the film's director, Joss Whedon. Meanwhile, Leonard's mother Beverly arrives in town for an extended visit, and Penny takes the opportunity to bond with her new mother-in-law - and to make up for not inviting her to the wedding. Comedy, guest starring Christine Baranski(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory (?)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me (?)
programme.desc: Interior designer Erika Sager hosts the second dinner party of the week on board her boat in Kingston upon Thames, south-west London, and invites her guests to dress up as pirates. Despite the unconventional setting, her rivals are all impressed by the standard of her food and hospitality(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me (?)
programme.desc: Mother-of-two Sarah Brice hosts the third dinner party in Kingston upon Thames, hoping to impress her guests with her own take on dishes including prawns, lamb and chocolate mousse. Ken Oputa tries to make an impression on the female contestants with his romantic poetry, but finds Erika Sager switches her attentions to his rival Jamie Baker(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me (?)
programme.desc: Photographer Jamie Baker hosts the fourth party in London, and his ambitious menu of langoustine and crab ravioli, herb crusted rack of lamb, and milloux of chocolate - combined with his choice of evening entertainment - go down well, until an unexpected turn of events scuppers his plans(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me (?)
programme.desc: Retired golfer David Witcher hosts the final evening in Kingston upon Thames, south-west London, and hopes to impress with an American-themed menu, including Wyoming slow-cooked ribs and Louisiana seafood chowder. However, some of the guests have issues with dust and the haddock served at breakfast - and challenge whether a night's stay is worth the price tag(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed (?)
programme.desc: Dave and Jo Bate welcome their guests to the White Horse, a pub and B&B in Ripon, North Yorkshire, where they hope an afternoon of morris dancing in front of the cathedral will make a lasting impression. Unfortunately, Ed and Jane Mitchell get locked inside their room by mistake, and there are arguments over tomatoes at breakfast(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed (?)

programme.title: Four in a Bed (?)
programme.desc: Payment day arrives, as the guests gather to find out who has won and to thrash out their differences - from some fishy findings to a reminder of why sorry can be the hardest word. Later on, a heated exchange about cleaning ends in tears(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me (?)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me (?)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me (?)

programme.title: Man Down (?)

Nevertheless, he sets about rescuing them from disaster and turning around the failing business(n)

programme.title: Great British Buildings: Restoration of the Year (?)
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud and Anna Keay visit some of the UK's most successful restorations of historic buildings, all of which have been placed on the Royal Institution of Chartered Surveyors' long list for their Restoration of the Year award. First up are a watermill brought back to life in Cambridgeshire, a seaside villa in Lyme Regis, a Georgian innovation in Northumberland, and a rescued castle in Ceredigion. At the end of the programme, Kevin and Anna hear which buildings have been chosen to make the final shortlist(n)

programme.title: The Voice UK
programme.desc: The sought-after contract with Polydor Records becomes ever more tangible a goal as the eight remaining would-be pop icons enter the semi-final. Having survived auditions, the battle rounds, the knockout stage and the quarter-finals, the contestants should be more than a little familiar with the pressures of a live performance. However, with a place in the grand final in the offing, the pressure has never been higher for the singers. As always, coaches Will.i.am, Tom Jones, Gavin Rossdale and Jennifer Hudson are on hand to deliver their verdicts on each performer's voice-work, and ultimately cut the number of hopeful stars by half, as only four competitors can progress through to the final. Emma Willis provides viewers with access to all the backstage drama and on-stage reactions as events unfold(n)

programme.title: Live World Cup 2018 Qualifier
programme.desc: England v Lithuania (Kick-off 5.00pm). Mark Pougatch presents coverage of the Group F clash between the countries at Wembley Stadium. Gareth Southgate's side currently top the qualifying table, but the manager will know his men need to maintain their good form if they are to remain in top spot, with Slovenia - who play Scotland later today - breathing down their necks in second place. programme.title: The Bill
programme.sub-title: Too Hot to Handle - Part One

The case progresses well, especially when Stevie's ex-boss Jim Rutherford turns up to help. Eventually her cover is blown by a member of the gang as the Sun Hill detectives close in for a sting operation, and Stuart is left questioning his colleague's loyalties when she whisks Towler away on her motorbike and disappears without trace. programme.title: The Bill
programme.sub-title: Too Hot to Handle - Part Two
programme.desc: Part two of three. The evidence against undercover cop Stevie mounts up, suggesting she has thrown away her career for the love of a villain. programme.title: The Bill
programme.sub-title: Too Hot to Handle - Part Three
programme.desc: Part three of three. In a flashback sequence, Stevie reveals to Stuart how she discovered the drug deal was a set-up and why she disobeyed instructions in order to protect her boyfriend. Stuart is astonished that her erratic behaviour was designed to save his life and expose the real villain behind the Tameside Crew. Plus, the story of Joanna and Andrew from Cwmbran, who combined all their benefits with a loan to pay for their wedding, which was shown live on Channel 5 in the summer of 2015(n)

programme.title: Don't Tell the Doctor
programme.desc: The medics help a woman who ended up in hospital after too much exercise and dieting, a Cardiff woman with a bowel problem and a singer who sweats too much(n)

programme.title: Home Shopping
programme.desc: A chance to purchase goods from the comfort of home(n)

programme.title: Rachel Allen's Easy Meals
programme.desc: The chef creates tasty Indian dishes for hectic lifestyles, including tarka dal and chicken biryani, and a mango and raspberry dessert. A group of local football fans try out a recipe at home, and Rachel also meets a friend and spice connoisseur at the Mahon Point market(n)

programme.title: Rachel Allen's Easy Meals
programme.desc: The chef prepares Mexican huevos rancheros for breakfast, spiced lamb pittas and a zingy Middle Eastern fattoush for late lunch or supper. Rachel also makes cheese with her mother-in-law and cooks for the local lifeboat crew(n)

programme.title: My Kitchen
programme.desc: Theo Randall serves up comfort food from his home kitchen, including beef bourguignon(n)

programme.title: My Kitchen
programme.desc: Theo Randall prepares for a dinner party by cooking ravioli with truffle and butter sauce, celery and bottarga, plus hazelnut meringues(n)

programme.title: Heston's Great British Food
programme.desc: Heston Blumenthal explores the history of the classic British pudding. He heads back to the early 1600s, when the way to make one was by stuffing the ingredients into an animal's intestine. The chef creates a rice pudding that looks like a hotdog, with a white chocolate mousse bun, pastry-fried onions, sweet soy sauce and saffron mustard, and makes a 17th-century pud involving a cow's udder. He also attempts a giant sponge pudding from the Victorian era and serves it to a specially invited group of teachers and dinner ladies(n)

programme.title: Heston's Great British Food
programme.desc: Heston Blumenthal delves into the history of iconic British dishes to find inspiration for a culinary salute, beginning with a three-course pie banquet. For his starter, he learns about the `surprise' pies of the 17th century and a dwarf boy who would jump out of one at a grand feast. Heston prepares a gala pie made up of beetroot and horseradish ice-cream in place of meat, with goat's cheese panna cotta, saffron and bacon, and the main course is a gothic affair inspired by Sweeney Todd. The chef also sets out to make the lightest ever mash with an attempt to change the molecular structure of a potato. The dinner is served to a select group of pie-makers 100ft in the air over the East End of London(n)

programme.title: Nigel Slater's Simple Suppers
programme.sub-title: Making It Up Isn't Making Do
programme.desc: Food writer Nigel Slater provides everyday cooking advice, preparing dishes that are uncomplicated and easy to remember, and encouraging viewers to grow their own fruit and vegetables. The first recipes include chicken cakes with herb mayonnaise, free-form trifle with raspberries and custard, bean soup, goat's cheese on garlic toast and tidy Friday pan fry(n)

programme.title: Nigel Slater's Simple Suppers
programme.desc: The food writer demonstrates how leftovers can be used to prepare tasty meals - using the remains of a Sunday roast and seemingly uninspiring scraps to create dishes including a chicken salad with cous cous and oranges, and potato cakes with a creamy sauce. He also visits allotment holders and is challenged to cook something using the freshest ingredients from their plots(n)

programme.title: Nigel Slater's Simple Suppers
programme.desc: Taking inspiration from his vegetable patch, the food writer demonstrates how combinations of ingredients that grow in the same place can make the ideal starting point for a dish. He also visits local allotment holders and uses their produce to create a feast(n)

programme.title: Nigel Slater's Simple Suppers
programme.desc: The food writer prepares easy recipes with classic ingredients, including sausages and mustard, pork chops with apples and cider, and carrot and coriander fritters. He also visits the Gilmore family and cooks a meal with ingredients from their allotment(n)

programme.title: Nigel Slater's Simple Suppers
programme.desc: The food writer provides a week's worth of meals using ingredients to create contrasting flavours, including recipes for chicken with lemon and honey, grilled prawns with yoghurt, and mint and pork meatballs with anchovies. He also visits a woman in London who grows her own vegetables(n)
